In this 1480 stained glass panel (East Harling, Norfolk: East Window, D1), the Virgin sits, richly dressed, on a sumptuous throne, holding the child who sits in her lap, reaching out a hand to the shepherd who doffs his cap with one hand and holds his crook with the other. (The striking blue of this shepherd's cape is found nowhere else in  this window). Two other shepherds stand behind, one holding a lamb, the other playing on pipes. In the background is the manger with ox and ass, while the star shines above. In the foreground, bottom left, is a domestic touch: a stool, upon which is a large ladle containing liquid, and a small spoon.
